meanings.definition: To coax or persuade by using flattery or charm.
meanings.sent1: She tried to blandish her way into getting a raise at work.
meanings.sent2: The salesman tried to blandish the customer into buying the expensive watch.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to blandish the dog into sharing its treats.
meanings.sent4: The politician blandished the voters with promises he couldn't keep.
meanings.sent5: Her sweet words blandished him into believing her lies.

meanings.definition: Flattering or pleasing in a subtle way.
meanings.sent1: The blandish painting on the wall added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent2: Her blandish smile charmed everyone at the party.
meanings.sent3: The blandish dress she wore made her feel like a princess.
meanings.sent4: The blandish music filled the room with a sense of tranquility.
meanings.sent5: The blandish scent of flowers in the garden was delightful.
